definition: solely preoccupied (with one thing)/engrossed/focusing (on sth)/to look after only one aspect
only/merely/just/but
grain that has begun to ripen/variant of 衹|只[zhi3]
variant of 只[zhi3]
variant of 只[zhi3]
classifier for birds and certain animals, one of a pair, some utensils, vessels etc
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to

sentences.english: He did not respond I have only concentrated on the very floor to Dongdong Dong.
sentences.chinese: 他没有回应我，只顾咚咚咚上得楼来。

sentences.english: The fish just moved away slowly and the old man could not raise him an inch.
sentences.chinese: 那鱼只顾慢慢地游开去，老人无法把它往上拉一英寸。

sentences.english: People drive right down a road and never notice an old woman like that.
sentences.chinese: 亻们只顾赶路，从不会注意到那样一个老。

sentences.english: He was so busy clocking her that he spilt a glass of beer over the table-cloth.
sentences.chinese: 他只顾目不转睛地盯着她，竟把一杯啤酒洒在桌布上。

sentences.english: But when they looked only to their footing, they did not see the elk .
sentences.chinese: 然而当他们只顾注意自己的脚步时，却看不到麋了。

sentences.english: "Too many people just run out the door, " says Mazzocchi.
sentences.chinese: “太多的人只顾急吼吼地离开，”马佐奇说。

sentences.english: Each one for himself in times of peril.
sentences.chinese: 在危难的时刻人人都只顾自己。

sentences.english: But, eyes raised, he drank in the pure night.
sentences.chinese: 但他只顾举目向天，啜饮纯净的夜色。

sentences.english: He is in from height merely ice bewail, be at a loss unexpectedly rise.
sentences.chinese: 他只顾自个儿在冰上叹惜，竟不知所措起来。

sentences.english: And the Rat pressed forward on his way without waiting for an answer.
sentences.chinese: 河鼠不等鼹鼠回答，只顾闷头向前赶路。

sentences.english: I was determined to become as self-involved and uncaring as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我决定要尽量只顾自己不再去表达关心了。

sentences.english: Who pleasure, not intentional of heaven, the Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 天道，只顾享乐，无心修佛。

sentences.english: A self-indulgent America opened the flood-gates of chaos .
sentences.chinese: 一个只顾自己的美国为混乱敞开了大门。

sentences.english: Maria thought speaking out of the question, and the gentlemen did nothing but eat and admire.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚根本不想讲话，男客们只顾一边吃一边赞美。

sentences.english: She stared at the beefcake and got lost.
sentences.chinese: 她因为只顾看那个猛男了，居然迷路了。

sentences.english: Only at swallow does rear its head.

definition: to take into consideration/to attend to
to immerse oneself in/engrossed in sth/to lower the head (e.g. to avoid rain)/countersunk (of screws, rivets etc)
to set one's heart on sth (idiom)
completely
continuously/persistently/incessantly
each minding his own business
blindly/invariably
to rush/in a hurry/to worry about being late
to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
totally unaware
from the start/absolutely/entirely/simply
to understand/to pay attention to/to take notice of
solely engrossed in one thing/just (one thing, no need to worry about the rest)/simply/by all means/please feel free/do not hesitate (to ask for sth)
with single-hearted devotion (idiom)
one side/either side/on the one hand/on the other hand/doing while
to concentrate/absorption/concentration/engrossed
